header.title: Esoteric Extension of Tarot to Develop Supersensory Powers

central_thesis: True wealth is not material but spiritual, rooted in a consciousness of gratitude, inner riches, and a willingess to love and serve, which can be developed through specific esoteric practices, including the use of Tarot symbolism, to accelerate spiritual evolution and attain higher consciousness.

structure_content.chapter_title: LESSON 31 Transcriptions from Ann Davies' Class Lectures
structure_content.summary: The lecture begins by establishing the author's authority on wealth and poverty through personal experience, defining poverty not just as lack of material goods but as a 'depression consciousness' or a lack of 'prosperity consciousness'. It argues that true wealth lies beyond the material and the dualistic 'wheel of opposites', emphasizing that everyone is inherently wealthy through consciousness, which continually creates. Material poverty, even with a good karma, can be a preparation for greater service in human evolution. The author shares personal anecdotes of experiencing extreme poverty while maintaining a sense of inner richness and gratitude, highlighting that the true measure of wealth is internal and not dependent on external circumstances. This inner richness is a test and a necessary stage of evolution, especially as preparation for serving in organizations like B.O.T.A. The lecture reframes wealth as an inner state of gratitude and ability to love, contrasting it with materialism and the frantic pursuit of money. It suggests that recognizing one's inherent riches accelerates spiritual progress and the development of supersensory powers.

This section delves deeper into the nature of wealth and poverty, asserting that true riches are found in one's soul, being, and life, and that real poverty is the inability to feel, love, express, or pour from within. It criticizes the materialistic definition of wealth and emphasizes that anyone with basic necessities (food, clothes, shelter) and the ability to live as a human being is inherently rich. The author shares a personal story about receiving a high-fidelity music system as a gift, initially questioning its necessity but ultimately accepting it, noting that true joy comes from appreciating what one has, not from acquiring more. The lecture reiterates that the focus should be on gratitude and pouring out love, which in turn attracts other things, rather than a frantic scramble for money. It contrasts this esoteric understanding with elementary metaphysics, suggesting a deeper, condensed learning process is available through their specific course. It posits that true riches are not about avoiding hurt but about being willing to risk it, to experience sorrow and disappointment as part of a cyclical flow towards life and God. The core message is that an attitude of gratitude for existence itself, even amidst misfortune, is the key to solving financial and existential problems, opening the door to the riches of consciousness.

structure_content.chapter_title: TECHNIQUE FOR TAROT KEY NO. 10, THE WHEEL OF FORTUNE
structure_content.summary: This section provides a practical technique for developing extrasensory perception and power using Tarot Key 10, The Wheel of Fortune. The technique involves visualizing oneself immersed in violet light and placing the four zodiacal signs in the corners of the key. The user is instructed to imagine themselves 'backing into' this key, connecting with the firmament and cosmic energies. Specific visualization instructions are given for positioning the wheel in relation to the body: the bottom at the solar plexus (attributed to Jupiter), the center at the heart/throat centers, and the top extending above the head. This technique is presented as a tool for gaining comprehension, feeling secure, and activating Higher Consciousness. An affirmation is provided for reinforcing the connection to the universe, one's destiny, and the Higher Self to gain necessary comprehension and security.

key_concepts.definition: An inner state of awareness and belief in abundance and well-being, distinct from mere material wealth. The absence of this is seen as a form of poverty.
A state of mind characterized by negativity, lack, and despair, which is considered a form of poverty.
A concept describing the dualistic nature of existence (e.g., good/bad, rich/poor) that one must transcend to achieve higher consciousness.
Inner wealth found in one's soul, being, life, abilities, capacities to feel, love, express, and pour from within. It is synonymous with an evolved consciousness and gratitude.
The inability to feel, love, express, or pour from within. It is the opposite of true riches, stemming from an inability to connect with one's inner essence.
Individuals who consciously participate in and facilitate the evolutionary processes of humanity, rather than being passively swept along by cycles.

A foundational practice for developing true wealth. It involves appreciating life, existence, and all one possesses, no matter how simple, leading to an overflow of love and attracting further abundance.
A Tarot key used in a specific esoteric technique to develop extrasensory perception and power, involving visualization and connection with cosmic energies and zodiacal signs.
Abilities beyond the normal senses, developed through esoteric training, consciousness expansion, and techniques such as those involving Tarot keys.

practical_system.description: The text presents a philosophy and a practical technique aimed at developing supersensory powers and spiritual wealth. The core philosophy redefines wealth as an internal state of consciousness characterized by gratitude, love, and the ability to create, transcending material definitions and the 'wheel of opposites'. The practical aspect is primarily embodied in the esoteric technique for Tarot Key 10, 'The Wheel of Fortune'. This technique is a meditative visualization exercise designed to enhance comprehension, security, and psychic awareness by engaging with the symbolism of the Tarot card and connecting with cosmic energies and one's Higher Consciousness.
tools: Violet Light (as a symbolic or energetic medium)
rituals: Visualization of oneself immersed in violet light.
Imagining the four zodiacal signs in the corners of Tarot Key 10.
Visualizing oneself 'backing into' Tarot Key 10, connecting body centers (solar plexus, heart, throat) to the wheel's structure.
Visualizing the Tarot wheel as a sphere passing through the body.
Meditative levitation to the center of the wheel, standing before the Sphinx.
Recitation of a specific affirmation to reinforce connection with the universe, destiny, and the Higher Self.

relevant_quotes.text: We need to acquire a truly perceptive spirit to develop a real grasp of the essence of riches. Everyone of us, curiously enough, is rich! We are wealthy beyond description, even if we have no job and are hungry or have no place to sleep. We are wealthy because we have consciousness which is continually creating out of the substance of life and the universe all things that are to be.
Experiencing poverty is something I am more grateful for than I can tell you. It gave me the opportunity to know, to feel, to do, to yearn towards others in a way I could never have otherwise.

We must begin to look at wealth and poverty in a different manner. We must begin to understand a little more of the whole feeling and value of Key 10. We cannot eliminate any stage of our growth, but it can be hastened and the work of B.O.T.A. is aimed at hastening our progress so that our cycles flow with greater and greater rapidity.
Real poverty is the inability to feel, to love, to express, to pour from within out. We must gain a deeper insight into the essential nature of wealth and poverty.

When the consciousness is busy being grateful and pouring out love and gratitude for what one has, then the other things come too, like rains to the thirsty earth. This is the secret of wealth and poverty, not the frantic scramble for money to spend.

Riches are bound up with what you feel regarding your own being, your own soul, your own life! These are the true riches, and no one is more poverty stricken than he who has put up a wall of protection in order not to be hurt by another or cheated by another or betrayed by another. No one is more poverty stricken than he, because he locks away life to preserve himself from hurt. He buries his talents in the ground.
Are these not riches? Be grateful that you can walk in the light of the sun and under the glory and radiance of the stars. Not to be grateful for all this is poverty, indeed!

AFFIRMATION: "There may be wheels within wheels, from the most minute to the most expansive, but I am eternal consciousness and in control of my destiny, through being an aspect and expression of the One Life. I, therefore, choose, in this instance, to feel the security of my relationship to the universe, and I call upon my Higher Self to give me what comprehension I require for this period or cycle."

critical_analysis.relevance: This text is highly relevant to practitioners of Western Esotericism, particularly those interested in Tarot, consciousness development, and the integration of spiritual principles into daily life, including concepts of wealth and poverty. It offers a distinct perspective that reframes material concerns through a lens of spiritual abundance and evolutionary growth, aligning with hermetic principles of 'as above, so below' and the cultivation of inner states to influence outer reality. The practical technique for Key 10 suggests a method for applying esoteric understanding to enhance perception and personal power.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary audience is advanced students or practitioners of esoteric systems, specifically those involved with B.O.T.A. (Builders of the Adytum) or similar groups that utilize Tarot and Kabbalistic frameworks. It is also relevant for individuals interested in non-dualistic approaches to wealth and poverty, consciousness studies, and the development of psychic or extrasensory abilities.
